intro: Lepidagathis justicioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or wild hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
